item.title: Complex Influence Propagation based on Trust-aware Dynamic Linear Threshold Models
item.description:
Overview

This project is a web-based simulation environment for Friend-Foe-Dynamic-Linear-Threshold (F2DLT) Models presented for the first time at TrustCom 2018 and further discussed in Applied Network Science 2019 and at SEBD 2020

If you follow the above link you will be presented with a user-friendly interface, that allows you to create/upload a diffusion graph and to run a diffusion process.

As the diffusion unfolds, the platform will show you real-time statistics about the current diffusion phenomena.

item.title: (Di)Graph Decompositions
item.description:
Overview

This project is developed as part of the following research paper:

A. Caliò, A. Tagarelli, F. Bonchi (2020). Cores matter? An analysis of graph decomposition effects on influence maximization problem. In Procs. of the 12th ACM Web Science Conference (WebSci-2020), July 6th - July 10th, 2020, Southampton, UK.

It contains a variety of graph-decomposition methods, specially adapted to be applied in an influence propagation problem – i.e., upon directed and weighted graphs.

Please follow the above link for detailed instructions on how to install and use this project.

item.title: ADITUM - Attribute DIversity-sensitive Targeted inflUence Maximization
item.description:
Overview

This project is developed as part of the following research paper:

A. Caliò, A. Tagarelli.Attribute based Diversification of Seeds for Targeted Influence Maximization problem. Information Sciences, 2020.

It contains the implementation of every influence maximization algorithm discussed in above paper. Pleas follow the link for detailed instructions on how to install and use this project.
